div.p: There are no upcoming events to display.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Corinth Holders High hosts ‘We Are One: A Unity Forum’

a.span: Corinth Holders High hosts ‘We Are One: A Unity Forum’

div.p: Corinth Holders High students, Johnston County Public Schools staff, and a community representative shared their personal experiences and shed light on the obstacles and roadblocks they have faced due to gender and ethnicity during a special community event.

a.title: Go to comments for Corinth Holders High hosts ‘We Are One: A Unity Forum’

img.alt: JCPS principals complete Distinguished Leadership Program

a.span: JCPS principals complete Distinguished Leadership Program

div.p: Johnston County Public Schools had two principals recently complete the Distinguished Leadership Program (DLP), a year-long leadership development program for practicing school principals.

a.title: Go to comments for JCPS principals complete Distinguished Leadership Program

img.alt: Meadow School tops Elementary Battle of the Books Competition

a.span: Meadow School tops Elementary Battle of the Books Competition

div.p: Meadow School was the first place winner of the Johnston County Public Schools Elementary School Battle of the Books Competition.

a.title: Go to comments for Meadow School tops Elementary Battle of the Books Competition

img.alt: RMS tops Middle School Battle of the Books Competition

a.span: RMS tops Middle School Battle of the Books Competition

div.p: The Riverwood Middle Ravens were the first place winner of the Johnston County Public Schools Middle School Battle of the Books Competition.

a.title: Go to comments for RMS tops Middle School Battle of the Books Competition
Subscribe to RSS Feed - JCPS News
a.span: Subscribe to RSS Feed - JCPS News

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: At this time, all traditional high school graduations are still planned for May 29. Graduation ceremonies for Johnston County Early College Academy and Johnston County Career and Technical Leadership Academy will now take place on May 16th, rather than the original date of May 15th.

a.title: Go to comments for Graduation Ceremony Information

div.p: JCPS has created a COVID-19 COmmunication website. This site features all of the latest information surrounding COVID-19, including meal sites and delivery information, support opportunities, learning at home, and more.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 District Updates

img.alt: Board of Education Budget Work Session set for April 27

a.span: Board of Education Budget Work Session set for April 27

div.p: The Johnston County Board of Education will hold a budget work session on Tuesday, April 27. The meeting will begin at 5:00 p.m. and be held in the Evander Simpson Building in Smithfield.

a.title: Go to comments for Board of Education Budget Work Session set for April 27
Subscribe to RSS Feed - JCPS Announcements
a.span: Subscribe to RSS Feed - JCPS Announcements
